content.description: Start matched on the bad sloper. Do a long reach to a sharp hold with your left hand followed by a desperate move to a sloping dish with the right. V0 from here.
content.location: From the parking, walk into the woods about 60-90 seconds looking uphill. Look for a steep arete with an obvious low sloper. About 60 ft uphill. If you reach SPAT you've gone just a little to far.

content.description: Start matched, glomming the nose of this obvious boulder. Get your heel up and right in the sloping section of rock and pull up to some small edges in the seam that help get you to a good hold to the left and eventually some better edges on the slab. Very fun with some unique beta.
content.location: Walk up the trail from the parking maybe 30 seconds and look uphill for what looks like a small nose.

content.description: Start on low holds on the face in the middle of the boulder. Do one move left to get to the arete and climb the arete to top out on it's left side once the lip of the boulder is reached.
content.location: Just uphill from the trail sitting behind another boulder is this obvious arete boulder problem.

content.description: These are the boulders that can be seen when you pass The Lies Boulder up on the right, slightly uphill.
